newsitem.title: USA: Greater Cincinnati area okays 1 of 4 school bonds.
newsitem.headline: Greater Cincinnati area okays 1 of 4 school bonds.

text.p: Voters in the Greater Cincinnati area passed only one of the four bond issues on the ballot in school districts in Tuesday's special election.
Voters in the Oak Hills Local School District approved $50.67 million of bonds for a new middle school, plus renovation and additional classrooms for other schools.
The Oak Hills referendum was for a 3.77-mill bond over 28 years for the district in west suburban Cincinnati.

Overwhelmingly defeated were bond issues in the Reading City School District of Hamilton County for $6.35 million, the Lebanon City Schools District in Warren County for $31 million, and Edgewood City Schools District in Butler County for $14.8 million.
